title: Swiss German
summary: Swiss German (Standard German: Schweizerdeutsch, Alemannic German: Schwiizerd端tsch, Schwyzerd端tsch, Schwiizert端端tsch, Schwizertitsch Mundart,[note 1] and others) is any of the Alemannic dialects spoken in the German-speaking part of Switzerland and in some Alpine communities in Northern Italy bordering Switzerland. Occasionally, the Alemannic dialects spoken in other countries are grouped together with Swiss German as well, especially the dialects of Liechtenstein and Austrian Vorarlberg, which are closely associated to Switzerland's.[3][4]
